page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: All the navigable waterways of this region connect with the {River Humber} and the port of Hull. The {Sheffield {and South Yorkshire Navigation (SSYN)} begins at Keadby where it joins the tidal {River Trent}passes through Thorne, Doncaster and Rotherham before reaching Sheffield, a distance of 43 miles, 28 locks built in 3 separate stages. The SSYN joins into the Aire and Calder Navigation which was more up to date than the SSYN. {Sprotborough Lock}was built in l980 to replace the original of l740, at a cost of Â£1.1m. It is 17m long, 6.6m wide and 3.5m deep. There is a rise and fall of 2m, with the gates and sluices powered by a total of 4 power packs. Each time the lock is used a total of 250,000 gallons of water is used. In l983 the lock won the title "Best Kept Lock in Britain".
